intro: Galium × mouretii, commonly known as the hybrid wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often heart-shaped with a hairy surface. Galium × mouretii is native to Europe and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
